pr_title: Create first backing index when creating data stream

timeline.bodyText: I think I remember @dakrone mentioning something about not starting from 0, rather from 1 like described in the ILM getting started guide. I am OK either way.
timeline.author: henningandersen

replies.bodyText: Good point. I think we should be consistent with what ILM does.
replies.author: danhermann

timeline.bodyText:
It would be good to add:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            
          
          
            
            assert firstBackingIndex != null;
          
      
    
    
  

since that is guaranteed to fail tests (the NPE occurring further down could be swallowed).
timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText: This looks unused? I think it makes more sense to add this when also building the indicesLookup.
timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText: We should end up asserting that existing != null, but that can be done in a followup together with populating indicesLookup
timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText:
I think this should instead validate that the entries in map are the same as those in ds.getIndices().
Right now it works in the initial create case, but not after we have deleted the first index.
Also it would be good to add a MetaDataTests test that validates that a data-stream pointing to backing indices (with random suffix number) works.
timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText: Let's add this in another change as well.
timeline.author: martijnvg

replies.bodyText: Never mind this comment. This change is necessary otherwise the first backing index of data stream can't be created.
replies.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText: We need to set the index.hidden setting here and test in testCreateDataStream() that it has been set.
timeline.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText:
Let's add the data stream index abstraction in another change? We can use the get index api in the yaml test to check that the index has correctly been created.
(the logic that adds data streams to the indicesLookup is missing here, which would need to be added too, but let's try to this pr small, so that it is easy to review)
(also a number of if statements in the code base may need to be revised because a new data stream type is introduced)
